body.p: Match the major segment of the aorta to the area it supplies.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The ascending aorta only contains branches that perfusion a single organ.
Incorrect. The ascending aorta is the most proximal segment to the heart and only has branches that perfuse one organ.
Correct. The ascending aorta contains the coronary sinuses with their openings to the right and left coronary arteries.
Incorrect. The branches of the ascending aorta only supply one organ.

part.hint: This is the only organ supplied by branches of this segment of the aorta.

response.feedback: Correct. The brachiocephalic is a branch of the aortic arch that contributes to perfusion of the right arm. The subclavian branch of the aortic arch delivers blood to the left arm.
Incorrect. The arch of the aorta is the most superior segment of the aorta, and its branches do not reach the abdominopelvic cavity.
Incorrect. The aortic arch contains branches for superior structures of the body, but not the heart.
Incorrect. The branches of the aortic arch supply the head and arms, not the structures of the ribs.

part.hint: Brachi- is the Greek work for arm, and one of the main branches off this segment contains brachi-- in its name.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The thoracic aorta does not include branches that supply the arms.
Incorrect. The branches of the thoracic aorta do not perfuse tissues below the diaphragm.
Incorrect. The heart is the only thoracic structure not supplied by branches of the thoracic aorta.
Correct. The branches of the thoracic aorta supply most tissues of the thoracic cavity, including the muscles in the wall of the cavity.

part.hint: Consider the cavity that the ribs help surround.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The abdominal aorta only supplies tissues below the diaphragm and the arms are superior to this area.
Correct. The branches of the abdominal aorta supply tissues of the abdominopelvic cavity.
Incorrect. The branches of the abdominal aorta only supply tissues below the diaphragm and the heart is superior to this structure.
Incorrect. The abdominal aorta only supplies tissues below the diaphragm and many of the muscles acting on the ribs are above the diaphragm.

part.hint: This is the most inferior segment of the aorta.
